channel.title: Microsoft on juri.strumpflohner
channel.description: Recent content in Microsoft on juri.strumpflohner

item.title: RT: Testing with VS2010 - A Bugs Life
item.description: I'm surely one who loves automated tests. Having them in place (with appropriate code coverage of course) and seeing the green bar or green check icons (depending on your IDE) just gives you the necessary peace for making changes to your application and for applying concepts like refactoring which otherwise is just as if you'd drive blindly (it may work, but it very much depends on your luck).

item.title: Visual Studio intellisense not working properly
item.description: Recently a work mate pointed me out that my Visual Studio Intellisense seemed to not work correctly. When writing... this.Page.GetPostBackClientEvent( ...the info with the remaining parameters should appear automatically which was not the case on my machine.

item.title: Visual Studio 2010 Beta2: Cannot start application
item.description: After installing the new Visual Studio 2010 Ultimate beta2 release today, I just started to play a bit, trying out the new features. One was to move the Solution Explorer panel out of the main Visual Studio frame onto my second monitor and then again back into the main window.

item.title: Microsoft Ajax CDN
item.description: Scott Gu' just announced the launch of Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network. The name already explains mostly everything. It allows you to retrieve Ajax script libraries for your web application by specifying things like this

item.title: Problems connecting to Windows Live Messenger account with Adium
item.description: I recently had a hard fight with Adium when trying to connect to my Windows Live account. It worked the 1st time and then suddenly it stopped working.

item.title: Image search: Bing vs. Google Image
item.description: Bing does a great job in displaying images. You get all of them displayed in the center of the page within a separate scrollable container.

item.title: Will Microsoft's Bing become Google's biggest threat?
item.description: Microsoft Live Search release wasn't a big success to compete Google on the search engine market. Now they're about to release Bing which is isn't thought to be another "

item.title: Microsoft Surface...the future of human-computer interaction?
item.description:
Here are some videos about Microsoft Surface. I wonder how long it will take to see one of these live :)
